remarks: The Teichmüller-Tukey Lemma, an Axiom of Choice equivalent.  If ` A ` is a nonempty collection of finite character, then ` A ` has a maximal element with respect to inclusion.  Here "finite character" means that ` x e. A ` iff every finite subset of ` x ` is in ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
statement:
ttukey.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
ttukey $p |- ( ( A =/= (/) /\ A. x ( x e. A <-> ( ~P x i^i Fin ) C_ A ) ) -> E. x e. A A. y e. A -. x C. y ) $.
$d A x y $.
